title: [CRASH] Loading Into Game
body: Every time I go into a game and I try to load in, the loading screen crashes. It tells me to turn off my firewall when my firewall is turned off. I try to restart my laptop, and shutting down my laptop. It has worked sometimes, but it's not really effective. The crashes are also very inconsistent, and it has become very frustrating for me to play.

replies.body: I'm not even concerned about my leaver level.  I'm concerned about being a douchebag and leaving my team in a 4v5.  I don't know them and I will probably never see them again, but still.  It's shitty.

The complete lack of an official response or update to the situation since last Tuesday is unacceptable.  Players are getting leaver bans and discipline for this problem on Riot's end?

F2P business model only works when customers have trust and this is ruining it.

Just had this crap happen for the 4th time in a row *today alone*, have had it occur another 3 times in the past week.  Previously was eventually able to reconnect after many tries, but ever since they did "Live server maintenance" on Saturday night I've not been able to connect any time I've encountered this problem.

If I see another friggin' skin come out before this gets fixed, Riot will never see another dime from me.

UPDATE:

I finally heard back on the support ticket where I provided match history links to the four games this problem ruined for me, and they said "We can't do anything about your leaver status because the system is automated."  Wow.  This is a slap in the face.  I've spent more than 200$ over the last 4 years supporting this game and purchasing content for it, and this is how you treat one of your longest-time paying customers?  Any business operating this way deserves to fail.  Now voting with my wallet.  I will never purchase RP again until Riot publicly acknowledges these connectivity issues and issues leaver-buster pardons to myself and all other players affected.  Until that happens, Riot has shown itself to be a company you CANNOT trust with your money or patronage.

The only problem is that all of the money I've already spent on your game feels like a huge waste, and I feel dumb for trusting this company and supporting this game.  Punish me for your failure to render service?  How incredibly obnoxious, and insulting.

Having this same problem consistently while my friends in Skype play unhindered. I have reset literally every device that contributes to internet as well as disabled the firewall. It's honestly getting old, if the servers are having issues don't hide it, just say "Hey the servers are kinda janky right now, play at your own peril" that way I'm not sitting here for hours trying to figure out what's wrong only to come here and see that it's a real problem.

I've only been playing the game for a little over a year now, and I have never, ever left a game.  Sadly this issue happens and after 20 minutes of trying to reconnect, I find  that my last game was marked with a "Leave"  I have no idea what's happening, but It's really disappointing that I'm labeled as a leaver because of an issue Riot is having.

Riot, we all understand that maintaining servers for the most popular and widely played game in the world can be quite an undertaking. We all recognize that servers go down and issues come up and that occasionally our individual gaming experience will be affected. 

That being said, we'd like you to recognize that most of the time when a server issue disconnects us from a game, we are penalized. We lose LP and get tagged with leaver penalties when we didn't actually do anything. We wanted to connect to the game and help the other 4 players on our team have a great time playing an awesome game. But we couldn't. Because your server wouldn't let us connect. So please don't penalize us for something that isn't our fault. 

Additionally, while this is a free to play game, I personally have decided to invest money in this game because I think it is fantastic and I want you guys to keep producing the best game I've ever played. But why should I keep giving you guys money if I don't ever see any results from my investment? I don't want new skins or new champs. I don't want a new LoL Patcher interface. I want a game that I can reliably connect to. I want a game where when the inevitable happens and the servers go down, I won't be penalized and dropped down the ladder.

If you can deliver that Riot,  I'll keep spending money. If you think that catering to your supporters and fans who have invested in your game is a waste of your time, I'll take my money elsewhere.
